html: 4.30.21  2:26 am   hello bill billson my question is how do i stop zoning out while listening to music? it seems like no matter how much i'm enjoying the music, no matter how interesting the music is, no matter how few distractions i have, i still zone out often during my music listening sessions. i also often have trouble paying 100% full attention to the music for more than like 10 seconds at a time. this doesn't mean i don't get to enjoy the music in the moment, just that it always takes multiple listens for me to digest a song or album and figure out how much i like it, if that makes sense. i can't imagine having any cohesive thoughts about a song or even remembering how it goes after listening to it only once, yet my music nerd friends seem to do all of this with ease. is there anything you think might help with this? sorry for the slightly unnecessarily-long winded question, and thank you in advance for any wisdom you may choose to dispense mr billiam wurtz

4.29.21  2:27 am   was the lack of V-I resolutions in i'm a princess intentional?

     i guess it just didn't come up. there is a tendency for all the princess sections to start on the 4 chord. so that's just the way it happened

      it increases the wistfulness.

     i suppose that's true. that destiny was likely sealed as soon as the first section was written the way it was

     same thing in got to know what's going on.

     now that i think about it, all those sections start on 4 also

     i think in these cases the music affects the perception of the lyrics.

     the music ALWAYS affects the perception of the lyrics, and the lyrics ALWAYS affect the perception of the music. that's the whole magic of the song game
